title-group.article-title: Experimental Data from the Block Island Wind/Diesel Project

abstract.p: Recent interest in wind/diesel hybrid systems has generated a need for reliable data sets from full-sized operational systems. This paper presents a summary of the work from a recent research project carried out at the University of Massachusetts using unpublished work from the NASA/DOE MOD-OA wind turbine installation with the diesel powered grid of the Block Island Power Company. It contains an analysis of previous technical reports/papers on the subject and gives new insight into the usefulness of this data. Using the earlier obtained data from the project, two 24 hour long runs of digital tape based data (based on a sampling rate of 10 samples per second) were reduced, calibrated, and analyzed. The resulting data analysis yielded the following information for such variables as wind speed, wind turbine power output, and diesel power output: 1) Time series plots 2) Histograms 3) Spectral analysis 4) Fuel input/power output relationships 5) Calculation of fuel savings/system efficiency Conclusions regarding fluctuation in power output of the MOD-OA, load variation on Block Island, fuel consumption versus power output relation of Diesel No. 9, and the effects of a simple storage scheme are made in the paper.
